subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] File uploading rules
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_009C_01C9D162.22516690
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Another thing:

I recently found this out. When you email a file, if it is =
not saved as a compressed format, the email filtering process will actually=
 compress the file automatically.

So even if you have attached a wav. file=
, it will loose resolution over the email process. It will not sound exactl=
y the same as the original wav. file. How much it differs depends on the si=
ze of the file you are attaching. If it is a very large file, it will sound=
 much different.

The only exception to this is if the wav. file is small e=
nough that the filtering process will ignore it. It has to be pretty small =
though, like under 1 MB (I am not exactly sure of the threshold).

The best=
 way to share files over the internet if you want them as close to the orig=
inal as possible is to upload them directly to a website.

  ----- Original=
 Message ----- 
  From: Rj 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, =
May 10, 2009 10:54 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] File uploading rules






 =
       Pixelization doesn't clean-up the data: it replaces it.  Imagine tak=
ing a picture of a field of flowers, and beginning to add levels or pixeliz=
ation to the picture.  Soon, you would not be able to tell there were flowe=
rs there at all.  You would see a lot of colored blocks.

        Or in the=
 other direction, imagine you are looking at a competely randomize bunch of=
 pixes on your screen: a complete screen of truely random static snow.  Pix=
elizing this, after a while, you would again start to see colored blocks.

=
        What's happening is that it is processing an area of the image, tak=
ing (for instance) the average value of that entire area, and replacing all=
 the blocks in that area with the average.  In video processing, this would=
 result in a field of multi-colored flowers being replaced by, for instance=
, a big greyish-bluish block, with no resemblance to flowers.  In the noise=
 example, it maybe replace all the random pixels with another big greyish-b=
luish block.  If you did not know beforehand what the original picture was,=
 you couldn't tell whether your pixelized image was really a field of flowe=
rs, a chevy, the sky with clouds, or a random bunch of pixels.

        It =
works the same with the sound files.  Taking something as complex as speech=
, and replacing frequencies with their averages, loses the speech the farth=
er you go, until you head strange fluctuating square waves.  Doing the same=
 to random static will eventually produce the same thing.  And random fluct=
uating square waves can sound a bit like speech - or at least, you could ha=
ve fun sharing with each other what you thing they 'sound like'.





     =
   --- On Sun, 5/10/09, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...> wrote:


       =
   From: Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...>
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC=
] File uploading rules
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Date=
: Sunday, May 10, 2009, 9:29 AM


                I always save the whole f=
ile in wav format then do my clips as mp3. Then I have the original for ana=
lysis. 

                As far as pixelization of non sounds/white noise w=
hos to say that isnt being manipulated by them as well LOL. Water is a form=
 of white noise. I seem to remember some experiments done with blank tapes/=
film, no recording done yet there were voices/images there. I find it all i=
nteresting.

                Just a thought. Ok off to work now!
          =
      Misty

                --- On Sun, 5/10/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> =
wrote:


                  From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com>
                 =
 Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] File uploading rules
                  To: EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups .com
                  Date: Sunday, May 10, 2009, 11:47 AM


 =
                       Be a bit careful of formats like mp3 if you are doin=
g a detailed analysis of the sounds though.   While some formats (like wav)=
 can store the audio very close to the way it was recorded, formats like mp=
3 compress the file, and in so doing lose some of the sonic details.  This =
may not be a big deal in music, where the audio is fairly clear to begin wi=
th.  But with sound sources with a lot of noise (like evps), this can not o=
nly obscure any real sounds, but pixelize non-sounds (like white noise) and=
 make them start to sound like speech.

                        So mp3 migh=
t be good for sharing the data, once you've already formed an opinion based=
 on an analysis of the wav file.  But mp3 is not good as a medium for analy=
sis.  It can lead to many false positives and misinterpretations.

        =
                --- On Sun, 5/10/09, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@ yahoo.com> wr=
ote:


                          From: Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@ yahoo.com>
=
                          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] File uploading rules
     =
                     To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                         =
 Date: Sunday, May 10, 2009, 8:26 AM


                                Than=
ks =3D)

                                 You will get the hang of it. Kris=
ten is right thats how you save it. For most softwares its under save as or=
 export as. If you still have trouble use one of the links I posted to help=
 ya out.

                                Misty

                          =
      --- On Sun, 5/10/09, SnowfireL@aol. com <SnowfireL@aol. com> wrote:

=

                                From: SnowfireL@aol. com <SnowfireL@aol. c=
om>
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] File uploading r=
ules
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
         =
                       Date: Sunday, May 10, 2009, 2:14 AM


              =
                  Ok, Misty I'll take them out, this recording stuff is new=
 to me.

                                In a message dated 5/10/2009 1:13:=
01 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time, bulletbabea@ yahoo.com writes:



          =
                      Please do not upload wav format files here they will =
have to be removed. Our group only has a very limited amount of space. Uplo=
ad bigger files and mass amount of files to your esnips.com accounts or els=
ewhere to be shared here using links. 

                                Mis=
ty

                                --- On Sat, 5/9/09, EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
 .com <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com> wrote:


                                F=
rom: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com>
                  =

             =

                                This email message is a notifica=
tion to let you know that
                                a file has been u=
ploaded to the Files area of the EVP-ITC 
                                g=
roup.

                                File : /Snowfirel/test1sou nds_like_=
 three_squeeking_ words.wav 
                                Uploaded by : =
snowfirel <SnowfireL@aol. com> 
                                Description=
 : Test1 these are last 3 words, can't make them out, haven't changed anyth=
ing on this one tape from last night aprox. 8 p. the whole tape with my mom=
 on it was around 4 minutes long, seems like these folks on the other side =
have a lot to say in a short time. 

                                You ca=
n access this file at the URL:
                                http://group=
s. yahoo.com/ group/EVP- ITC/files/ Snowfirel/ test1sounds_ like_three_ squ=
eeking_ words.wav 

                                To learn more about fil=
e sharing for your group, please visit:
                                htt=
p://help. yahoo.com/ l/us/yahoo/ groups/original/ members/web/ index.htmlfi=
les

                                Regards,

                            =
    snowfirel <SnowfireL@aol. com>
